page.title: 06Transport in Colmonell
page.content: Colmonell is one of the few areas in Scotland that has a community bus as its only means of public transport.The bus is called the Honey Bee. The Honey Bee runs to Ballantrae once a day (At around lunch time.) and to Girvan three times a day during the week. The Honey Bee is unusual in that on Saturdays it runs a limited service to Girvan with volunteer drivers from the community instead of its usual driver. The bus can also be hired by local community groups in the evenings or on Sundays. The Honey Bee is also used to transport the pupils who travel to and fro from Girvan Academy and to bring school lunches from Girvan to the village primary school.
